title: Water challenge in Moutse and Tafelkop remain Challenge ”
text:
An aspect of drinkable water to the residents of Moutse has been a bone of contention for a very long period of time, in that the access to clean, drinkable water, and for that matter any water, has been lacking in the area, depriving the residents of a basic guaranteed constitutional right.
Water is about dignity and areas without water give rise to diseases like cholera, diarrhea and typhoid, and some residents even have to share their supply of water with animals in the area, and this is not acceptable in any kind of normal situation.
The Sekhukhune District Municipality seems to be dragging its feet in supplying fresh piped and drinkable water to its residents and as such the situation of lack of water has become a ticking time bomb, where a caring government would never allow this kind of situation to be, and in some instances where Municipalities are even returning grants to Department Water Affairs that should have been spent on infrastructure development which is indicative of poor management and a lack of care.
Failure to spend such grants allocated for service delivery was an afford to people who relied on the Municipality to provide them with such basic service.
If the situation was relevant to one specific area one can possible have some kind of understanding for the situation but most of the area, and for that matter most of the residents are deprived of the supply of water.
This is not in any way something new, and various efforts made even while the area was still considered a cross boundary area have born no fruit. Even a reticulation built at Ntwane ward 10 a cost of more than R 10 million by the Mpumalanga Government never became operational as bulk water supply to the plant was conspicuously absent in the planning of the project. And now all the equipment used in the construction of the facility has been vandalized and is of no use to address the dire need that exists.
And now an in-depth study has been conducted to address the supply of fresh drinkable water to residents and all on the surface appears well, but once the water and for that matter bulk water is supplied to the area, the lack of infrastructure reticulation of the water, would only contribute further to the access being a major stumbling block.
The Executive Mayor in her annual address to the residents of the area, clearly set out a goal to provide residents with clean, drinkable, piped water within 200mm of their residence has boiled down to nothing, as there is no visible plans in place to alleviate the problem as a matter of urgency.
Water, Aqua, Meetse, H2O …… not something that the residents of Moutse can consider their basic right to have no matter what!
